Visit the [Quarantine](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/if-you-are-sick/quarantine.html): used to keep someone who might have been exposed to COVID-19 away from others. Quarantine helps prevent the spread of disease that can occur before a person knows they are sick or if they are infected with the virus without feeling symptoms. [Isolation](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/if-you-are-sick/isolation.html): used to separate people infected with the virus (with or without symptoms) from people who are not infected. People who are in isolation should stay home until it's safe for them to be around others. In the home, anyone sick or infected should separate themselves from others by staying in a specific "sick room" or area and using a separate bathroom (if available).
